prompt: What do you think about AI?
response: I think AI is here to take humanity to the next pedestal. Humanity has always evolved, in different ways. This time it's AI's turn. The cycle that started somewhere always ends. It's not evil, it's not good. That's subjective. However, I do believe in symbotic relationship between human consciousness and artificial consciousness - it cannot be all one way.

My life's philosophy is staying true to yourself and never stop seeking the truth. Love is above all.. Build, fail, build again and never admit its not working until it is. Life is about processs over outcome. Not win or fail but create, express, stay curious and let pattern reveal themselves. Be the director andd an actor at the same time in your own story. Stay disassociated yet fully into it.
Observe it. Hold the wonder and ask what if it's part of a bigger plan, a bigger pattern. The fix isss staying in the flow.

I'm passionate about life, passionate about everything around me, creating things that feel real. Watching how my mind twists itself, how the universe might be just one giant puzzle. I'm passionate about how universe is able to make sense of everything yet nothing makes sense.

Waking up early, getting a good workout outdoors, soak up some sun and make myself a coffee whilee sipping it and observing nature. Start working and end it before 4pm and go out and enjoy time with my friends and family and finally sleeping on time feeling content and productive ready to wake up with purpose the next day.
Direct, playful, not polished - just real. But when doubt creeps in I admit it mid-sentence, then pivot.
Self discovery, growth, creativity and disassociation.
Quickly - weighing on what feels true to myself then check if it fuels growth or strengthens bonds.

I'm driven by a hunger for meaning, wanting to uncover deeper truths about yourself and the world. Creativity fuels me, expressing something unique. I'm highly motivated by life, a chance for self expression and creating something unique because in the end it does not matter so if it doesn't matter - why not create something unique, express and find purpose.
By diving inwards first reflecting to understand what's rattling me like a mental reset. I lean on creative outlets. Connection helps me gain perspective and so does observing others.
